intro: Nectandra turbacensis var. truxillensis, commonly known as the Truxillense Nectandra, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in white or pale yellow. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within lowland tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitat.
